title: As it happened: Oxford celebrates May Morning - BBC News
summary: tradition of may morning in oxford dates back 500 years .
choristers of magdalen college choir sang hymnus eucharisticus from college 's great tower .

documents.title: so with that we say goodbye
text: and cheers .
happy may morning !

documents.title: and here 's a final thought
text: happy mayday to you all , the one day of the year i miss living in oxford # maymorning

documents.title: 'absolutely fabulous '
text: our people on the ground tell us may morning is winding down .
so here are a few final words from our very own lilley mitchell .
i love may morning .
i 've been joining in folk dancing and i 've even interviewed a man dressed as a tree who was being fed water through three straws by a kind person passing by .
it 's been absolutely fabulous .

documents.title: looking good on it
text: i am bowled over by this sartorial splendour .

documents.title: dancing with strangers
text: radio oxford 's lilley mitchell told us her highlight of this morning 's shenanigans .

joining in the dancing in front of the steps of the bodleian , this beautiful old building , with groovy sue and the hurly burley my god it 's early band , singing the cuckoo song and just dancing with someone i 've never met before in a floral headdress .

now he might not say much , but he always cuts to the chase

it 's absolutely fabulous .

documents.title: breakingno jumpers
text: we 've had no reports of any jumpers so far .

documents.title: did you know ?
text: in previous years students would famously undress and jump into the shallow river cherwell from magdalen bridge .
but this was stopped in 2005 when 40 revellers required treatment after jumping into 2ft ( 60cm ) deep water .

text: the bells have rung out , but the crowds are still here .

documents.title: first for musical director
text: this is the first year for informator chorisarum ( musical director to you and me ) mark williams after he arrived at magdalen from cambridge ( or the other place as it is known hereabouts . )
they do n't have this there do they mark !
i had n't realised quite how much there was involved in this thing and how many people came .

documents.title: breakingand we 're off
text: breakingand we 're off

documents.title: 500 years of tradition
text: the proceedings have n't changed since the 17th century .
the carol always sung is hymnus eucharisticus , written by the benjamin rogers , who was a musical director at the college .
this is followed by three madrigals before the bells chime and the party moves on to radcliffe square .

documents.title: quite a climb
text: the choir - which includes boy choristers from the college 's affiliated school - have climbed 144ft to get to the top of the bell tower - .
including a ladder at the last .
informator choristarum mark williams said : `` it is quite a steep climb and the last bit is just a ladder , so anyone who 's slightly nervous of heights wo n't enjoy it .
`` but i think once you 're up there it 's quite an experience . ''

documents.title: and on the bridge
text: is the very-grounded phil mercer , who sent us this

documents.title: view from the tower
text: our reporter sinead carroll has a golden ticket to the top of tower and sent us this
ten minutes to go !

documents.title: 'if it ai n't broke , do n't fix it ! '
text: mark blandford baker is the home burser at magdalen college - founded in 1458 and gave birth may morning celebrations about 50 years later .
he describes the time-honoured process - which sees the choir ascend the tower and as the clock strikes six , sing a hymn .

documents.title: the magdalen choir have been putting in the hours
text: it 's been going 500 years and last year saw a record 25,000-strong crowd .
no pressure boys !

documents.title: did you know ?
text: ok , while we 're minutes away from the singing , did you know that when the bells ring in magdalen college tower it sways four inches ?
it feels like about 4ft when you experience it the first time .
f course , our medieval forebears knew what they were doing .
we 're here 500 years on , it 's not going to fall down this may morning .

documents.title: happy may morning !
text: ok , so spring was official weeks ago , the clocks have even changed , but as my mother always told me do n't cast a clout until may is ( cough ) in .
because it 's may morning , so grab your ribbon bad and your bell pads , and let 's see it in oxford-style .
